comment.author: 15772938@N03
comment._content:
This is the March - April, 1912 Lowell strike -- same strike as the photo of Big Bill Haywood with young strikers.  The dispute began in the Merrimack's Number 1 weave room on March 25 and then spread to Lowell's other cotton mills as a strike and lockout.
The workers might be picketing but they also might be showing up for their pay .
